org.xbib.elasticsearch.index.analysis.combo

Class ReaderCloneFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xbib.elasticsearch.index.analysis.combo.ReaderCloneFactory

  • public class ReaderCloneFactory
extends Object
    Duplicates Readers in order to feed multiple consumers.

    This class registers multiple implementations, and tries to resolve which one to use, looking at the actual class of the Reader to clone, and matching with the most bond handled classes for each ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner implementation.

    By default, a few Reader implementations are handled, including the most used inside Lucene (StringReader), and a default, fallback implementation that merely reads all the available content, and creates a String out of it.

    Therefore you should understand the importance of having a proper implementation for any optimizable Reader. For instance, StringReaderCloner gains access to the underlying String in order to avoid copies. A generic BufferedReader

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner<T extends Reader>
      Interface for a utility class, able to clone the content of a Reader, possibly in an optimized way (such as gaining access to a package private field, or through reflection using AccessibleObject.setAccessible(boolean)).
      static interface  ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderUnwrapper<T extends Reader>
      Interface for a utility class, able to unwrap a Reader inside another Reader.

      • bindCloner

        public static <T extends Reader> WeakReference<Class<? extends ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner>> bindCloner(Class<? extends T> handledClass,
                                                                                            Class<? extends ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner<T>> clonerImplClass)
        Add the association between a (handled) class and its handling ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The base handled class of the ReaderCloner.
        Parameters:
        handledClass - The base class that is handled by clonerImplClass. Using this parameter, you can further restrict the usage of a more generic cloner.
        clonerImplClass - The class of the associated cloner.
        Returns:
        The previously associated ReaderCloner for the handledClass.

      • bindUnwrapper

        public static <T extends Reader> ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderUnwrapper bindUnwrapper(Class<? extends T> handledClass,
                                                                  ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderUnwrapper<T> unwrapperImpl)
        Add the association between a (handled) class and its handling ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderUnwrapper instance.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The base handled class of the ReaderUnwrapper.
        Parameters:
        handledClass - The base class that is handled by clonerImplClass. Using this parameter, you can further restrict the usage of a more generic cloner.
        unwrapperImpl - The instance of the associated unwrapper.
        Returns:
        The previously associated ReaderUnwrapper instance for the handledClass.

        public static <T extends Reader> ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner<T> getClonerStrict(T forReader)
        (Advanced) Returns an initialized ReaderCloner, associated with the exact class of the given Reader. If the initialization fails, this function returns null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The base handled class of the ReaderCloner to return.
        Parameters:
        forReader - The handled class bond to the ReaderCloner to return.
        Returns:
        The bond, initialized ReaderCloner, or null.

      • getCloner

        public static <T extends Reader,S extends T> ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner<T> getCloner(Class<T> baseClass,
                                                                          Class<S> forClass,
                                                                          S forReader)
        (Advanced) Returns an initialized ReaderCloner, associated with the given base class, for the given Reader. If the initialization fails, this function returns null.

        The function first tries to match the exact class of forReader, and initialize the ReaderCloner. If no ReaderCloner or (tested second) ReaderUnwrapper matches, the resolution continues with the super class, until the baseClass is reached, and tested.

        If this process is not successful, null is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The base handled class of the ReaderCloner to return
        S - The class of the given Reader to handle
        Parameters:
        baseClass - The baseClass, above which the resolution will not try to continue with the super class.
        forClass - The class to start with, should be the class of forReader (but the latter can be null, hence this parameter)
        forReader - The Reader instance to return and initialize a ReaderCloner for. Can be null.
        Returns:
        An initialized ReaderCloner suitable for the givenReader, or null.

      • getCloner

        public static <T extends Reader,S extends T> ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner<T> getCloner(Class<T> baseClass,
                                                                          Class<S> forClass)
        Returns a ReaderCloner suitable for handling general Ss instances (inheriting T, itself inheriting Reader).

        Resolution starts on forClass (S), and does not go further than baseClass.

        Not all optimizations can be ran, like unwrapping and failing initialization fallback. However, for standard cases, when performance is really critical, using this function can reduce a possible resolution overhead because ReaderCloner are reusable.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The base handled class of the ReaderCloner to return
        S - The class of the given Reader to handle
        Parameters:
        baseClass - The baseClass, above which the resolution will not try to continue with the super class.
        forClass - The class to start with, should be the class of forReader (but the latter can be null, hence this parameter)
        Returns:
        An uninitialized ReaderCloner suitable for any T Readers, or null.

      • getCloner

        public static <S extends Reader> ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner<Reader> getCloner(Class<S> forClass)
        Returns a ReaderCloner suitable for handling general Ss instances (inheriting Reader).

        Calls ReaderCloneFactory.getCloner(Reader.class, forClass, (S)null).

        Not all optimizations can be ran, like unwrapping and failing initialization fallback. However, for standard cases, when performance is really critical, using this function can reduce a possible resolution overhead because ReaderCloner are reusable.

        Type Parameters:
        S - The class of the given Reader to handle
        Parameters:
        forClass - The class to start with, should be the class of forReader (but the latter can be null, hence this parameter)
        Returns:
        An uninitialized ReaderCloner suitable for any S, or null.

      • getCloner

        public static <S extends Reader> ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner<Reader> getCloner(S forReader)
        Returns an initialized ReaderCloner, for the given Reader.

        Calls ReaderCloneFactory.getCloner(Reader.class, (Class)forReader.getClass(), forReader). If forReader is null, works as getGenericCloner().

        Type Parameters:
        S - The class of the given Reader
        Parameters:
        forReader - The Reader instance to return and initialize a ReaderCloner for. Can be null.
        Returns:
        An initialized ReaderCloner suitable for given Reader, or null.

      • getGenericCloner

        public static ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner<Reader> getGenericCloner()
        Returns a ReaderCloneFactory.ReaderCloner suitable for any Reader instance.
